rows.RECRUITING PITCH DECK — DESIGN SPEC: Visual spec for AI generation or manual design. One consistent template across all 5 slides.

rows.col_2: Dark navy (#0D1B2A) or charcoal (#1B2838). Not black — too harsh. Not white — too corporate.
White (#FFFFFF) for headlines. Light gray (#E0E0E0) for body.
Electric blue (#4FC3F7) or IonWave brand color (TBD). Used for highlights, borders, key numbers.
Inter Bold or similar geometric sans-serif. Large (36-48pt). Left-aligned.
Inter Regular. 16-20pt. Left-aligned. Generous line spacing.
Left-heavy. Headline top-left. Body below. Right side: supporting visual (AI-generated product render, team photo, or abstract). 60/40 text-to-visual ratio.
IonWave wordmark top-right. Small. Consistent placement every slide.
No gradients. No stock photos. No clip art. No bullet point icons. No "startup pitch deck" templates from Canva. This should look like it was designed by someone with taste.
Bloomberg terminal meets Stripe's marketing site meets MKBHD thumbnails. Professional but not boring. Dark but not edgy.

"Generate a 16:9 presentation slide with dark navy background (#0D1B2A). White bold sans-serif headline top-left. Body text in light gray below. Right side has a subtle abstract geometric pattern in electric blue. Clean, minimal, professional. No stock photos. Stripe/Bloomberg aesthetic."
PDF (sendable via email/DM). Also as Notion page (linkable). Also as 5 images for social/Discord.
BEFORE any recruiting call. The candidate reads this first. The call is to answer questions, not to explain what you're building.
Slides 1-4 are identical for everyone. Slide 5 is customized per role. Recruiter swaps Slide 5 template for each candidate.
Update Slide 4 (Who's Already In) every time someone new joins. The deck gets more compelling as the team grows.
